Package partsapp.windows.main

Class MainWindow

java.lang.Object
partsapp.windows.main.MainWindow
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class MainWindow
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Window controller class for the starting window of the application.

    • refreshInventoryParts

      private void refreshInventoryParts()
      Retrieve the list of parts from the inventory and populate local list. Filtering is performed if there is a search parameter filled.

    • refreshInventoryProducts

      private void refreshInventoryProducts()
      Retrieve the list of products from the inventory and populate local list. Filtering is performed if there is a search parameter filled.

      Throws:

    • handlePartsDeleteButtonClick

      public void handlePartsDeleteButtonClick()
      Event handler for the delete parts button, removing a part from the inventory.

      Note: A runtime error was encountered in the following method. The error was caused by initially using the selectedPartIndex value to call Inventory.getAllParts.get(selectedPartIndex), resulting in the incorrect product being removed inventory if the customer was removing during a part search. To remedy this issue, the getAllParts() reference was replaced with the filteredParts variable used locally which the search is correctly being applied against.

    • handleProductsAddButtonClick

      public void handleProductsAddButtonClick() throws java.lang.Exception
      Event handler to open the window for adding a product.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - if the window was unable to be instantiated
